Review_title: We all deserve to be seen
Review_Text: I don't really enjoy the typcially underdog turned superstar story so I thought I'll hate this. But it's very well done. It didn't portrayed people with disabilities in a negative light. They are filmed as people that are capable and independent. It's done a great job humanize them.Everyone has that feeling where they don't feel seen or celebrated. I figure that's why it is so touching to watch. It is a beautiful story of ordinary people trying to do the right thing. Nothing is over done. I just wish they have included more of the model's backstory.
This is the result of believing in people. what we all can achieve when others believe in us end our capability to do what we love. fantastic, magical, beautiful human beings.

The most joyful beautiful true movie about young people and the challenges they have faced and the amazing journey that the future gave them. So natural and beautiful, full of positive comedy and heartfelt moments. Love and laughter the whole way.

Review_title: A roller coaster of emotions that leaves no heart untouched
Review_Text: I don't think I have ever been so emotionally involved in a film ever before. I cried, I laughed and I was overwhelmed by the warmth and the sheer brilliance of the characters. It is an important statement that everybody counts, everybody deserves to shine and no one has that right to label any human being.
